name: places/ChIJWekBIAFZwokRUuCNi2ez1hM
formattedAddress: 455 W 47th St #1A, New York, NY 10036, USA
adrFormatAddress: 455 W 47th St #1A, New York, NY 10036-2304, USA

originalText.text: I am convinced that Holly is magical. The perspective she takes on acting technique is unlike anything I’ve ever tried and allowed me to really tap into my emotional and physical healing. Her teaching is fiercely inclusive and individual, and I love the way she champions artists’ values. I really want to continue studies in Alexander Technique thanks to Holly, and I will apply her techniques in my everyday life as well as my performance. I feel like my emotions are much more connected to my body and I understand how and why thanks to her. She also has the most calming presence I have ever been around, and I enjoyed every second.

originalText.text: Working with Holly has been a game changer. As a young opera singer, I’ve often been told to “drop my walls”, but Holly helped me understand that my nervous system creates those walls for a reason. Instead of pushing those walls down and making my nervous system feel even more unsafe, Holly helped me find ways to orient to a space and connect with it and my scene partners. I now can sing with greater connection and honesty. I feel greater freedom in my body, too, both on and off stage. Would absolutely recommend to artists of all disciplines (and even to folks who don’t identify as artists!). Thank you Holly!

originalText.text: Working with Holly is an experience I could not recommend enough. She is a kind, thoughtful, and kindred spirit who is a pleasure to work with. Holly helped me find ground and connection to my body, create healthier mindsets and find more genuine characters. Loved every moment of her class. Thank you Holly!

text.text: Working with Holly is an experience I could not recommend enough. She is a kind, thoughtful, and kindred spirit who is a pleasure to work with. Holly helped me find ground and connection to my body, create healthier mindsets and find more genuine characters. Loved every moment of her class. Thank you Holly!

originalText.text: I’ve been working with Holly on theatre monologues and TV/film sides during quarantine. In these strange times of self-taping, Holly has helped me to use the space that I have available to my advantage. Holly’s coachings and classes give me tools for a more embodied performance. I feel like I have more agency over my body and my space. I would also recommend Holly’s yin yoga class. If you’re like me and your mind moves a mile a minute, this class feels so good. I love that we also use our voices in class. It’s a great release and just like in her acting classes, Holly has a way of helping me to claim and thrive in my space and my body.

originalText.text: I really loved my experience working with Holly on both scenes and monologues. She has a great way of making an actor feel present, and she is always available, present for our questions and generous of her time. She is very skilled and knowledgable in the craft of Alexander Technique, and has a genuine passion for helping actors become more grounded in themselves and engaged in their matierial. Thanks, Holly!
